required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Recombinant Human C1 Esterase Inhibitor in Healthy Adult Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Ascending Dose, Phase 1 Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Single Intravenous and Subcutaneous Doses of Recombinant Human C1 Esterase Inhibitor in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is looking to gain information about the safety and tolerability of an investigational treatment (SHP623) in healthy adult volunteers. This study will also collect pharmacokinetic data (how the body absorbs and breaks down the study drug).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs ) including SAEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1 to day 28 per treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum concentration occurring at tmax (Cmax) of IV SHP623
Time to reach the maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of IV SHP623
Terminal half-life (t ½) of IV SHP623
Area under the plasma concentration curve from time zero to infinity (AUC0-∞) of IV SHP623
Area under the plasma concentration curve from time zero to 168 hours postdose of IV SHP623
Area under the curve from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration (AUClast) of IV SHP623
Total body clearance for intravascular administration (CL) of IV SHP623
Volume of distribution associated with the terminal slope (Vz) following IV administration of SHP623
Maximum concentration occurring at tmax (Cmax) of SC SHP623
Time to reach the maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of SC SHP623
Terminal half-life (t ½) of SC SHP623
Area under the plasma concentration curve from time zero to infinity (AUC0-∞) of SC SHP623
Area under the plasma concentration curve from time zero to 168 hours postdose of SC SHP623
Area under the curve from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration (AUClast) of SC SHP623
Total body clearance for extravascular administration divided by the fraction of dose absorbed CL/F (SC) of SC SHP623 adult
Volume of distribution associated with the terminal slope following extravascular administration (Vz/F)divided by the fraction of dose absorbed of SHP623

arm_group.description: Treatment A: 9 Subjects will receive dose level I of SHP623 intravenously (IV). B: 9 Subjects will receive dose level I of SHP623 subcutaneously(SC).
3 Subjects will receive placebo for each cohort

intervention.description: Subjects will receive escalating doses I-IV as both IV and SC injections

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Must be considered healthy. Healthy status is defined by absence of evidence of any active or chronic disease
2. Male, or non-pregnant, non-lactating female, who agrees to comply with any applicable contraceptive requirements of the protocol, or females of non-child-bearing potential.
3. Body mass index between 18.0 and 30.0 kg/m2 inclusive with a body weight >50 kg (110 lbs.). This inclusion criterion will be assessed only at the first screening visit.
4. Hemoglobin ≥12.0g/ld.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Have a history of allergic reaction to C1 INH products (e.g. C1 Inhibitor [Human], Berinert [C1 Estrace Inhibitor (Human)] and C1 estrace [recombinant]
2. Known history of alcohol or other substance abuse within the last year.
3. Donation of blood or blood products within 60 days prior to receiving investigational product.
4. Current use of any medication except hormonal replacement therapy, hormonal contraceptives and occasional use of any over-the-counter non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) or acetaminophen.
5. Have a history of hypercoagulability or other predisposition to thrombotic events.
